ground_truth: Findley spots Bert, takes a long drag on his cigarette, and saunters toward them. Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers, pretending to forget Findley's name; he nods to them all and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs, looking on at the party below. Holding the rail with one hand, and a champagne glass in the other, she maneuvers her way down the steps. She stops a waitress on the way upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one. We follow her unsteady, doll-like descent as she moves slowly, dreamily past the combo, past Eddie, who is cornered by a chic blonde in a low-cut dress, and past Findley, alone with his drink, observing his guests; she continues past the bleary-eyed couples on the dance floor, until she comes to the bar. Bert is there too, his head bobbing to the Dixie beat, his eyes running over her body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress. Spinning away from him, she takes her glass and goes to a corner of the room. Bert walks casually to her side, leans over, and whispers something in her ear. Her face hardens, and angrily she turns and throws her champagne in his face and smashes her glass on the floor. She starts to cry and starts to fall, but Bert holds her up by the shoulders. The music stops, and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened. Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd, tries to take her in his arms, but she beats on his chest, sobbing, unable to make words. Eddie drags her limp, trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go, wiping the champagne off his coat lapels. The music starts up again. A Negro maid sits patiently in the room, watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on. A woman enters and, disgusted, pushes Sarah off her fur coat. Eddie appears in the doorway, and the woman takes her coat and leaves. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment, then turns and walks out. Findley, drink and cork-tipped cigarette in hand, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room. It is a beautifully appointed salon, wood-paneled, filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta Roman statuary. In the center of the room is the billiard table, now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the bar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table, but it's not a pool table -- it's a billiard table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Findley notices Bert, takes a lengthy puff on his cigarette, and strolls toward them. Bert gestures to Eddie and snaps his fingers, feigning to forget Findley's name; he nods to them all and departs. Sarah gives Bert a glance. The camera inclines upward from a Dixieland ensemble blaring out a lively melody to find Sarah descending the stairs, gazing at the gathering below. Holding the rail with one hand, and a champagne flute in the other, she maneuvers her way down the steps. She halts a waitress on the way upstairs and swaps her glass for a fresh one. We follow her unsteady, doll-like descent as she moves slowly, dreamily past the ensemble, past Eddie, who is cornered by a chic blonde in a low-cut dress, and past Findley, alone with his drink, observing his guests; she continues past the bleary-eyed pairs on the dance floor, until she comes to the bar. Bert is there too, his head nodding to the Dixie rhythm, his eyes scanning over her body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress. Twirling away from him, she takes her glass and proceeds to a corner of the room. Bert strides casually to her side, leans over, and murmurs something in her ear. Her face hardens, and angrily she spins and hurls her champagne in his face and shatters her glass on the floor. She starts to weep and begins to fall, but Bert holds her up by the shoulders. The music halts, and the dance couples strain to get a glimpse at what has transpired. Eddie pushes through the staring crowd, attempts to take her in his arms, but she beats on his chest, sobbing, unable to utter words. Eddie drags her limp, trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them depart, wiping the champagne off his coat lapels. The music resumes. A Negro maid sits patiently in the room, watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on. A woman enters and, disgusted, nudges Sarah off her fur coat. Eddie appears in the doorway, and the woman takes her coat and departs. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment, then turns and walks out. Findley, drink and cork-tipped cigarette in hand, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room. It is a beautifully appointed salon, wood-paneled, filled with plush couches and adorned with terra cotta Roman statuary. In the center of the room is the billiard table, now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the bar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table, but it's not a pool table -- it's a billiard table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert, takes a long drag on his cigarette, and saunters toward them. Eddie is pointed to by Bert, who snaps his fingers, pretending to forget Findley's name; a nod is given to them all, and he leaves. Bert is given a look by Sarah. The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs, looking on at the party below. The rail is held by her with one hand, and a champagne glass is held in the other as she maneuvers her way down the steps. A waitress is stopped by her on the way upstairs, and she exchanges her glass for a new one. Her unsteady, doll-like descent is followed by us as she moves slowly, dreamily past the combo, past Eddie, who a chic blonde in a low-cut dress corners, and past Findley, alone with his drink, observing his guests; she continues past the bleary-eyed couples on the dance floor until the bar is reached by her. Bert is there too, bobbing his head to the Dixie beat, and his eyes run over her body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress. Spinning away from him, she takes her glass and goes to a corner of the room. Casually, Bert walks to her side, leans over, and whispers something in her ear. Her face is hardened by his words, and angrily, she turns and throws her champagne in his face and smashes her glass on the floor. Crying is started by her, and she starts to fall, but Bert holds her up by the shoulders. The music is stopped, and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened. Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd, tries to take her in his arms, but she beats on his chest, sobbing, unable to make words. Eddie drags her limp, trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while they are watched by Bert, wiping the champagne off his coat lapels. The music starts up again. In the room, a Negro maid patiently sits, watching over Sarah and the coats on which Sarah is lying. A woman enters and, disgusted, pushes Sarah off her fur coat. Eddie appears in the doorway, and her coat is taken by the woman, who leaves. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment, then turns and walks out. Findley, drink and cork-tipped cigarette in hand, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room. A beautifully appointed salon, wood-paneled, filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta Roman statuary, is shown. In the center of the room, there is the billiard table, now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the bar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that was covering the table, but it’s not a pool table -- it’s a billiard table. The table is finished being uncovered by Eddie.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert, takes a drag on his cigarette, and approaches. Bert points to Eddie, snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name, nods, and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera pans from a Dixieland combo to Sarah descending the stairs, holding the rail and a champagne glass. She exchanges her glass with a waitress on the stairs. We follow her dreamlike descent past the combo, Eddie, cornered by a chic blonde, and Findley, alone observing guests; she moves past couples on the dance floor to the bar. Bert is there, eyes roving her body in a cotton dress. She turns, throws her champagne in his face, and smashes her glass on the floor, crying. Bert holds her up. The music stops, and couples stare. Eddie pushes through, tries to hold her, but she sobs and beats his chest. Eddie carries her across the dance floor as Bert wipes champagne from his coat. The music resumes. A maid watches over Sarah and the coats she lies on. A woman pushes Sarah off her coat. Eddie enters, looks at Sarah, and leaves. Findley escorts Bert and Eddie to his game room, a wood-paneled salon with plush divans and terra cotta statues. In the center is a covered billiard table. Eddie uncovers it eagerly, revealing a billiard table.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Findley sees Bert, takes a drag on his cigarette, and approaches. Bert points to Eddie, snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name, nods to them, and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera tilts from a Dixieland combo playing to Sarah descending the stairs, observing the party. Holding a rail and champagne, she exchanges her glass with a waitress. She moves past the combo, past Eddie with a blonde, and past Findley, watching his guests, to the bar. Bert watches her and whispers something, leading her to angrily throw champagne in his face and smash the glass. She starts to cry and fall, but Bert holds her up. The music stops as couples watch. Eddie shoves through the crowd, tries to comfort her, but she hits him, sobbing. Eddie carries her across the floor while Bert wipes champagne off his coat. The music resumes. A maid watches over Sarah and the coats she lies on. A woman pushes Sarah off her coat, takes it, and leaves. Eddie looks at Sarah, then leaves. Findley escorts Bert and Eddie to his game room, a plush, wood-paneled salon with Roman statues and a billiard table covered by a cloth. Eddie uncovers it eagerly, revealing it's a billiard table.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Findley notices Bert in the distance and, after taking a long, deliberate drag on his cigarette, begins to saunter casually toward him. Bert, spotting Eddie, points in his direction and snaps his fingers as if trying to remember something, pretending for a brief moment to forget Findley's name. After nodding to everyone present, he turns and makes his departure. Sarah, observing the interaction, gives Bert a meaningful look. The camera then tilts upward, moving away from the energetic Dixieland combo that is enthusiastically blaring out a lively, bouncy tune, until it captures Sarah descending the stairs. She gazes down at the lively party unfolding below. Grasping the rail with one hand for balance while holding a champagne glass delicately in the other, she gracefully maneuvers her way down the steps. As she proceeds, she pauses momentarily to stop a waitress who is on her way upstairs, exchanging her used glass for a fresh, new one. We then follow her slightly unsteady, doll-like descent, watching as she drifts slowly and dreamily past the musically animated combo, past Eddie, who finds himself cornered by a fashionable blonde wearing a daringly low-cut dress, and past Findley, who stands alone with his drink, quietly observing the assembled guests. She continues onward, gliding past the bleary-eyed couples swaying on the dance floor, until she finally reaches the bar. Bert is present there as well, his head rhythmically bobbing to the Dixie beat, his eyes openly surveying her figure beneath her plainly covered cotton print dress. She spins away from him abruptly, takes her glass, and heads to a secluded corner of the room. Bert nonchalantly walks over to her side, leans in closely, and whispers something in her ear. Her expression hardens instantly; in a flash of anger, she turns sharply and throws her champagne in his face, letting her glass smash onto the floor. Overcome with emotion, she begins to cry and almost collapses, but Bert catches her by the shoulders, holding her up. The music halts suddenly, and the dancing couples strain to catch a glimpse of the commotion. Eddie pushes his way through the crowd of onlookers, attempting to take her into his arms, but she beats against his chest, sobbing uncontrollably, unable to form words. Gently, Eddie carries her trembling, limp body across the dance floor to the stairs, while Bert watches them depart, wiping the champagne from his coat lapels. The music resumes once more. A Negro maid waits patiently in the room, keeping a watchful eye over Sarah and the coats on which she is now lying. A woman enters with an air of disgust, shoving Sarah off her precious fur coat. As Eddie steps into the doorway, the woman gathers her coat and leaves. He pauses, looking at Sarah for a brief moment, before turning to walk out. Findley, holding both his drink and a cork-tipped cigarette, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his elegantly appointed game room. This room is beautifully decorated, featuring wood paneling and plush divans, and accented with terra cotta Roman statuary. At the heart of the room is the billiard table, currently hidden under a cloth cover. As Findley heads to the bar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth, revealing that it is not a traditional pool table. Instead, it is a billiard table, which Eddie finishes uncovering.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Findley, standing at a distance, spots Bert and, after savoring a long, intentional drag on his cigarette, begins a leisurely, almost nonchalant walk toward him. Meanwhile, Bert, catching sight of Eddie, gestures in his direction and casually snaps his fingers, as if trying to jog his memory, playfully pretending for an instant to have forgotten Findley's name. After acknowledging the gathered individuals with a nod, he turns away and takes his leave. Observing the exchange, Sarah gives Bert a look filled with unspoken meaning. The camera then shifts its focus upward, moving away from the lively, spirited Dixieland combo that is energetically filling the air with a vibrant, bouncy tune, until it finds Sarah, who is gracefully descending the stairs. She looks down on the lively, bustling party unfolding below her. With one hand firmly grasping the rail for support and the other delicately holding a champagne glass, she skillfully maneuvers her way down the steps. As she makes her way down, she pauses briefly to intercept a waitress ascending the stairs, exchanging her empty glass for a fresh, full one. Our attention then follows her slightly unsteady, almost doll-like descent, as she drifts slowly and dreamily past the musically animated combo, past Eddie, who is now engaged with a chic blonde in a daringly low-cut dress, and past Findley, who stands alone with his drink, quietly surveying the gathered guests. Continuing her path, she glides serenely past the bleary-eyed couples entwined on the dance floor, until she arrives at the bar. Bert is there, his head moving in time with the Dixie rhythm, his eyes openly assessing her figure beneath her simply adorned cotton print dress. She spins away from him with a suddenness, takes her glass, and retreats to a secluded corner of the room. Bert casually ambles over to her side, leans in closely, and murmurs something into her ear. Her demeanor hardens with immediate severity; with a burst of anger, she swings around sharply and hurls her champagne into his face, letting the glass crash onto the floor. Overwhelmed by emotion, she starts to weep and nearly collapses, but Bert catches her by the shoulders, preventing her from falling. The music abruptly ceases, and the dancing couples strain to witness the commotion. Eddie pushes through the throng of onlookers, attempting to comfort her, but she beats against his chest, her sobs shaking her body, unable to articulate any words. Gently, Eddie lifts her quivering, limp form across the dance floor toward the stairs, while Bert remains standing, watching them leave, wiping the champagne from his coat lapels. The music resumes once again. A Negro maid stands waiting patiently in the room, her watchful eyes on Sarah and the coats she is now lying on. A woman enters, her demeanor one of disdain, as she pushes Sarah away from her prized fur coat. As Eddie enters the doorway, the woman retrieves her coat and departs. He pauses, casting a momentary glance at Sarah, before turning to exit. Findley, holding both his drink and a cork-tipped cigarette, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his elegantly furnished game room. This room is beautifully embellished, featuring rich wood paneling and plush divans, and further highlighted by terra cotta Roman statues. At the center of attention in the room is a billiard table, presently concealed beneath a cloth cover. As Findley makes his way to the bar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth, unveiling that it is not a standard pool table. Instead, it is a billiard table, which Eddie completes uncovering.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Findley fixes his gaze on Bert, taking a deep, contemplative drag from his cigarette as he begins to move with a slow, relaxed stride toward his destination. As he approaches, Bert catches sight of Eddie and, with a moment of playful forgetfulness, snaps his fingers as if struggling to recall Findley's name before he acknowledges everyone with a knowing nod and exits the scene. Sarah, witnessing this exchange, gives Bert a pointed look. Meanwhile, the camera gradually tilts upwards, capturing the lively energy of a Dixieland combo energetically playing a bouncy melody, before focusing on Sarah as she gracefully descends the stairs, her eyes scanning the lively party unfolding beneath her. With one hand securely gripping the rail for balance and the other delicately holding a champagne glass, she carefully navigates her way down the staircase. On her way, she halts a waitress ascending the stairs to exchange her empty glass for a fresh one. Our attention follows her measured, almost doll-like descent as she glides past the musicians of the combo, making her way past Eddie, who appears somewhat ensnared by the attention of a stylish blonde dressed in a revealing gown, and then past Findley, who stands solitarily with a drink in hand, quietly observing his guests from afar. She continues her elegant journey, weaving through couples on the dance floor swaying dreamily to the music with bleary eyes, until she finally arrives at the bar. There, she finds Bert, who is absorbed in the spirited rhythm of the Dixie beat, his head moving in sync with the music, his eyes appreciatively tracing the contours of her body, modestly clad in a cotton print dress. Abruptly spinning away from him, she takes possession of her newly acquired glass and retreats to a secluded corner of the room. Bert casually follows her, closing the distance between them, and leans in to murmur something into her ear. Instantly, her expression transforms, hardening with anger as she turns sharply, hurling the champagne onto his face before letting the glass fall dramatically to the floor, shattering upon impact. Overcome with emotion, she begins to cry and stumble, but Bert quickly reacts, supporting her by the shoulders to keep her from collapsing. The music abruptly halts, prompting the dance couples to strain their necks for a better view of the commotion. Eddie pushes through the curious onlookers, reaching Sarah in an attempt to comfort her, but she defensively beats against his chest, sobbing uncontrollably and unable to articulate her distress. Eddie then wraps his arms around her quivering, weakened frame and painstakingly escorts her across the dance floor toward the stairs, while Bert watches them retreat, casually wiping the remnants of champagne from his coat lapels. As the music resumes, a Negro maid sits quietly in a room, keeping an eye on both Sarah and the coats upon which she lies. A woman enters, glancing with disdain as she brusquely moves Sarah aside to retrieve her fur coat. Eddie appears in the doorway as the woman takes her coat and departs. He pauses momentarily to regard Sarah, then turns away and exits. Findley, with a drink in one hand and a cigarette with a cork tip in the other, accompanies Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his luxurious game room. The room is tastefully appointed, its wood-paneled walls adorned with plush divans and elegant terra cotta Roman statues. In the center stands a table draped with a cloth, which Eddie enthusiastically begins to remove, revealing underneath not a pool table as he expected, but a billiard table. He completes the uncovering of the billiard table, ready for the next chapter of their evening's entertainment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Findley notices Bert, takes a drag from his cigarette, and moves over to join them. Bert forgets Findley's name briefly but acknowledges everyone and exits. Sarah, observing this exchange, gives Bert a look. The scene shifts to Sarah descending the stairs, clutching the rail and a champagne glass, as a Dixieland combo plays energetically. She trades her empty glass for a fresh one while descending in a dreamy, unsteady manner past the ongoing party, including Eddie and Findley. As she reaches the bar, she encounters Bert, who checks her out. Annoyed, she spins away, throws her champagne at him, and smashes the glass, then starts to fall, but Bert catches her. The music abruptly stops as onlookers strain to see the commotion. Eddie pushes through the crowd to comfort Sarah, who resists, beating his chest in tears. He manages to lead her across the dance floor while Bert cleans his suit. The music resumes. A maid watches over the room where Sarah lies on coats. When a woman enters to retrieve her fur coat, Sarah is shoved aside. Eddie arrives, sees Sarah momentarily, then departs. Downstairs, Findley, with his drink and cigarette, escorts Bert and Eddie to a luxurious game room with wood paneling and Roman statuary. Findley heads to the bar, and Eddie eagerly reveals a billiard table under a cloth.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert amidst the bustling party, takes a long drag on his cigarette, a brand renowned for its smooth flavor, and saunters toward them. Bert, who is known for his teasing antics, points to Eddie and snaps his fingers, pretending to forget Findley's name; he nods to them all and leaves with a casual air of indifference. Sarah gives Bert a look that conveys more than words ever could. The camera tilts upward from a lively Dixieland combo, a type of jazz popular in the early 20th century, blaring out a bouncy tune, to find Sarah, elegantly dressed for the occasion, descending the stairs, looking on at the lively party below. Holding the rail with one hand, and a champagne glass filled with an expensive vintage in the other, she maneuvers her way down the steps. She stops a waitress, part of the well-staffed team ensuring the event runs smoothly, on the way upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one, appreciating the fresh bubbles. We follow her unsteady, doll-like descent as she moves slowly, dreamily past the combo, past Eddie, who is cornered by a chic blonde in a low-cut dress that turns heads, and past Findley, alone with his drink, observing his guests with the air of a seasoned host; she continues past the bleary-eyed couples on the dance floor, entranced by the night's festivities, until she comes to the bar. Bert is there too, his head bobbing to the Dixie beat, his eyes running over her body so plainly covered by a simple cotton print dress, despite the extravagance around her. Spinning away from him, she takes her glass and goes to a corner of the room, seeking solitude. Bert walks casually to her side, leans over, and whispers something in her ear that clearly crosses a line. Her face hardens, and angrily she turns and throws her champagne, an expensive vintage wasted, in his face and smashes her glass on the floor, a dramatic gesture that captures everyone's attention. She starts to cry and starts to fall, but Bert holds her up by the shoulders, gaining unwanted attention. The music stops, and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened, their curiosity piqued by the commotion. Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd, tries to take her in his arms, but she beats on his chest, sobbing, unable to make words amidst her emotional turmoil. Eddie drags her limp, trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go, wiping the champagne off his coat lapels, a testament to the night's excess. The music starts up again, attempting to restore normality. A Negro maid, dedicated and patient, sits in the room, watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on, an emblem of service in the era's societal structure. A woman enters and, disgusted by the scene, pushes Sarah off her fur coat, a symbol of her status. Eddie appears in the doorway, and the woman takes her coat and leaves, her priorities clear. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment, then turns and walks out, his mind weighed down by the night's events. Findley, with a drink and cork-tipped cigarette, a popular choice among refined smokers, in hand, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room, a sanctuary of leisure. It is a beautifully appointed salon, wood-paneled, filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta Roman statuary, reflecting a taste for classical elegance. In the center of the room is the billiard table, now covered by a cloth, hiding the night's entertainment. Findley goes to the bar, ever the gracious host, while Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table, but it's not a pool table -- it's a billiard table, a subtle distinction appreciated by connoisseurs. Eddie finishes uncovering the table, ready for the next chapter in the evening's unfolding drama.

Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name. he nods to them all and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs looking on at the party below. We follow her unsteady dolllike descent as she moves slowly dreamily past the combo past Eddie who is cornered by a chic blonde in a lowcut dress and past Findley alone with his drink observing his guests. she continues past the blearyeyed couples on the dance floor until she comes to the bar. The music stops and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd tries to take her in his arms but she beats on his chest sobbing unable to make words. Eddie drags her limp trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go wiping the champagne off his coat lapels. The music starts up again. A Negro maid sits patiently in the room watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on. A woman enters and disgusted pushes Sarah off her fur coat. Eddie appears in the doorway and the woman takes her coat and leaves. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment then turns and walks out. Findley drink and corktipped cigarette in hand escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room. It is a beautifully appointed salon woodpaneled filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta. Roman statuary. In the center of the room is the billiard table now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the bar. Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table but it is not a pool table. it is a billiard table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert takes a long drag on his cigarette and saunters toward them. Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name. he nods to them all and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs looking on at the party below. Holding the rail with one hand and a champagne glass in the other she maneuvers her way down the steps. She stops a waitress on the way upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one. We follow her unsteady dolllike descent as she moves slowly dreamily past the combo past Eddie who is cornered by a chic blonde in a lowcut dress and past Findley alone with his drink observing his guests. she continues past the blearyeyed couples on the dance floor until she comes to the bar. Bert is there too his head bobbing to the Dixie beat his eyes running over her body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress. Spinning away from him she takes her glass and goes to a corner of the room. Bert walks casually to her side leans over and whispers something in her ear. Her face hardens and angrily she turns and throws her champagne in his face and smashes her glass on the floor. She starts to cry and starts to fall but Bert holds her up by the shoulders. The music stops and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd tries to take her in his arms but she beats on his chest sobbing unable to make words. Eddie drags her limp trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go wiping the champagne off his coat lapels. The music starts up again. A Negro maid sits patiently in the room watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on. A woman enters and disgusted pushes Sarah off her fur coat. Eddie appears in the doorway and the woman takes her coat and leaves. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment then turns and walks out. Findley drink and corktipped cigarette in hand escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room. It is a beautifully appointed salon woodpaneled filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta. Roman statuary. In the center of the room is the billiard table now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the bar. Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table but it is not a pool table. it is a billiard table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name. he nods to them all and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs looking on at the party below. Holding the rail with one hand and a champagne glass in the other she maneuvers her way down the steps. She stops a waitress on the way upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one. We follow her unsteady dolllike descent as she moves slowly dreamily past the combo past Eddie who is cornered by a chic blonde in a lowcut dress and past Findley alone with his drink observing his guests. test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert takes a long drag on his cigarette and saunters toward them. Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name. he nods to them all and leaves. Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table but it is not a pool table. it is a billiard table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Findley spots the giraffe, takes a long drag on his cigarette, and saunters toward them. The giraffe points to the magician and snaps his fingers, pretending to forget Findley's name; the magician nods to them all and leaves. The astronaut gives the giraffe a look. The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find the astronaut descending the stairs, looking on at the party below. Holding the rail with one hand, and a champagne glass in the other, the astronaut maneuvers their way down the steps. The astronaut stops a librarian on the way upstairs and exchanges the glass for a new one. We follow the astronaut's unsteady, doll-like descent as the astronaut moves slowly, dreamily past the combo, past the magician, who is cornered by a chic blonde in a low-cut dress, and past Findley, alone with his drink, observing his guests; the astronaut continues past the bleary-eyed couples on the dance floor, until the astronaut comes to the bar. The giraffe is there too, his head bobbing to the Dixie beat, his eyes running over the astronaut's body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress. Spinning away from him, the astronaut takes their glass and goes to a corner of the room. The giraffe walks casually to the astronaut's side, leans over, and whispers something in the astronaut's ear. The astronaut's face hardens, and angrily the astronaut turns and throws their champagne in the giraffe's face and smashes their glass on the floor. The astronaut starts to cry and starts to fall, but the giraffe holds the astronaut up by the shoulders. The music stops, and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened. The magician shoves through the gawking crowd, tries to take the astronaut in his arms, but the astronaut beats on his chest, sobbing, unable to make words. The magician drags the astronaut's limp, trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while the giraffe watches them go, wiping the champagne off his coat lapels. The music starts up again. A koala sits patiently in the room, watching over the astronaut and the coats that the astronaut is lying on. A penguin enters and, disgusted, pushes the astronaut off her fur coat. The magician appears in the doorway, and the penguin takes her coat and leaves. The magician looks at the astronaut for a moment, then turns and walks out. Findley, drink and cork-tipped cigarette in hand, escorts the giraffe and the magician down the stairs to his game room. It is a beautifully appointed salon, wood-paneled, filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta Roman statuary. In the center of the room is the billiard table, now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the bar, the magician eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table, but it's not a pool table -- it's a billiard table. The magician finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert, takes a long drag on his cigar, and saunters toward them. Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers, pretending to forget Findley's name; he nods to them all and leaves. Sarah gives Bert a look. The camera tilts upward from a jazz quartet blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the ladder, looking on at the event below. Holding the rail with one hand, and a wine glass in the other, she maneuvers her way down the steps. She stops a stewardess on the way upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one. We follow her unsteady, doll-like descent as she moves slowly, dreamily past the quartet, past Eddie, who is cornered by a chic blonde in a sequined gown, and past Findley, alone with his cocktail, observing his guests; she continues past the bleary-eyed couples on the dance floor, until she comes to the counter. Bert is there too, his head bobbing to the jazz beat, his eyes running over her body so plainly covered by a velvet evening gown. Spinning away from him, she takes her glass and goes to a nook of the chamber. Bert walks casually to her side, leans over, and whispers something in her ear. Her face hardens, and angrily she turns and throws her wine in his face and smashes her glass on the ground. She starts to cry and starts to fall, but Bert holds her up by the shoulders. The music stops, and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened. Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd, tries to take her in his arms, but she beats on his chest, sobbing, unable to make words. Eddie drags her limp, trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go, wiping the wine off his shirt cuffs. The music starts up again. An elderly butler sits patiently in the room, watching over Sarah and the rugs that Sarah is lying on. A woman enters and, disgusted, pushes Sarah off her silk scarf. Eddie appears in the doorway, and the woman takes her scarf and leaves. Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment, then turns and walks out. Findley, drink and cork-tipped cigar in hand, escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his study. It is a beautifully appointed lounge, wood-paneled, filled with plush sofas and decorated with marble Greek statuary. In the center of the room is the ping-pong table, now covered by a cloth. Findley goes to the minibar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table, but it's not a ping-pong table -- it's a foosball table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Findley notices Bert, inhales deeply on his cigarette, and ambles toward them. Bert gestures toward Eddie and claps his hands, feigning ignorance of Findley's name; he waves to them all and exits. Sarah casts Bert a glance. The camera pans upward from a Dixieland combo playing a lively tune to reveal Sarah ascending the stairs, gazing at the gathering below. Holding the rail with one hand and a champagne glass in the other, she navigates her way up the steps. She pauses a waiter going downstairs and swaps her glass for a fresh one. We observe her shaky, doll-like ascent as she drifts slowly, dreamily past the combo, past Eddie, who is engaged by a chic blonde in a low-cut dress, and past Findley, alone with his drink, surveying his guests; she drifts past the bleary-eyed couples on the dance floor, until she reaches the bar. Bert is there too, his head bobbing to the Dixie beat, his eyes scanning over her body so plainly cloaked by a cotton print dress. Spinning away from him, she grabs her glass and heads to a corner of the room. Bert strolls casually to her side, leans over, and murmurs something in her ear. Her face stiffens, and furiously she turns and splashes her champagne in his face and shatters her glass on the floor. She begins to weep and starts to stumble, but Bert steadies her by the shoulders. The music halts, and the dance couples stretch to get a glimpse of what has occurred. Eddie pushes through the staring crowd, attempts to embrace her, but she thumps on his chest, sobbing, struggling to speak. Eddie hauls her limp, quivering body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert observes them leave, dabbing the champagne off his coat lapels. The music resumes. A Negro maid sits patiently in the room, keeping watch over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is reclining on. A woman enters and, disdainfully, shoves Sarah off her fur coat. Eddie enters the doorway, and the woman grabs her coat and departs. Eddie glances at Sarah for a moment, then turns and strides out. Findley, drink and cork-tipped cigarette in hand, accompanies Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room. It is a beautifully appointed salon, wood-paneled, filled with plush divans and adorned with terra cotta Roman statuary. In the center of the room is the billiard table, now draped with a cloth. Findley moves to the bar, Eddie eagerly rolls back the cloth that drapes the table, but it's not a pool table -- it's a billiard table. Eddie completes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Bumblebee spots Giraffe, takes a long drag on its harmonica, and saunters toward them. Giraffe points to Dodo and snaps its antennae, pretending to forget Bumblebee's tune; it nods to them all and leaves. Cactus gives Giraffe a look. The mirror tilts upward from a tap-dancing robot blaring out a jazzy melody to find Cactus descending the window, looking on at the parade below. Holding the rope with one branch, and a teacup in the other, it maneuvers its way down the elevator. It stops a penguin on the way upstairs and exchanges its cup for a new one. We follow its unsteady, puppet-like descent as it moves slowly, dreamily past the robot, past Dodo, who is cornered by a chic dolphin in a low-cut hat, and past Bumblebee, alone with its drum, observing its trees; it continues past the yawning elephants on the dance floor, until it comes to the sofa. Giraffe is there too, its nose bobbing to the jazzy beat, its fins running over its spines so plainly covered by a silk plaid scarf. Spinning away from it, Cactus takes its cup and goes to a corner of the forest. Giraffe walks casually to Cactus's side, leans over, and whispers something in its leaf. Its face hardens, and angrily Cactus turns and throws its tea in Giraffe's face and smashes its cup on the rug. It starts to wail and starts to fall, but Giraffe holds it up by the branches. The melody stops, and the prancing elephants strain to get a look at what has shifted. Dodo shoves through the gawking river, tries to take Cactus in its fins, but it beats on its shell, sobbing, unable to make clouds. Dodo drags its limp, quivering shadow across the dance floor to the window while Giraffe watches them go, wiping the tea off its shoes. The melody starts up again. A robotic antelope sits patiently in the forest, watching over Cactus and the mittens that Cactus is lying on. A cloud enters and, disgusted, pushes Cactus off its silk mitten. Dodo appears in the doorway, and the cloud takes its mitten and leaves. Dodo looks at Cactus for a moment, then turns and walks out. Bumblebee, drum and metal-tipped harmonica in wing, escorts Giraffe and Dodo down the window to its jungle. It is a beautifully appointed cavern, stone-walled, filled with velvet hammocks and decorated with iron penguin sculptures. In the center of the cavern is the puzzle table, now covered by a shawl. Bumblebee goes to the sofa, Dodo eagerly pulls back the shawl that covers the table, but it's not a puzzle table -- it's a riddle table. Dodo finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Frank spots Tony, takes a quick sip from his soda, and prances toward them. Tony gestures to Charlie and claps his hands, pretending not to recall Frank's name; he waves to them all and departs. Rachel gives Tony a glance. The camera pans upward from a jazz quartet playing a lively melody to find Rachel ascending the stairs, observing the gathering below. Grasping the banister with one hand and a cocktail glass in the other, she glides her way up the steps. She intercepts a waiter on the way downstairs and swaps her glass for a fresh one. We follow her unsteady, puppet-like climb as she moves slowly, serenely past the quartet, past Charlie, who is encircled by a stylish brunette in a plunging gown, and past Frank, alone with his beverage, scrutinizing his guests; she continues past the bleary-eyed pairs on the dance floor, until she arrives at the lounge. Tony is present too, his head nodding to the jazz rhythm, his eyes scanning her figure so modestly clothed by a woolen skirt. Whirling away from him, she grabs her glass and strides to a secluded corner. Tony strolls leisurely to her side, leans in, and murmurs something in her ear. Her expression stiffens, and furiously she spins and spills her cocktail in his face and hurls her glass to the floor. She begins to weep and starts to stagger, but Tony supports her by the elbows. The music halts, and the dancing pairs crane their necks to see what has occurred. Charlie pushes through the gawking throng, tries to embrace her, but she pounds on his chest, sobbing, unable to articulate. Charlie maneuvers her limp, quivering form across the dance floor to the stairs while Tony observes them leave, dabbing the cocktail off his vest. The music resumes. A Latina attendant sits calmly in the room, overseeing Rachel and the coats that Rachel is perched on. A woman enters and, irritated, nudges Rachel off her mink coat. Charlie emerges in the doorway, and the woman retrieves her coat and exits. Charlie glances at Rachel for a moment, then turns and strides out. Frank, beverage and straw-tipped cigarette in hand, guides Tony and Charlie down the stairs to his entertainment room. It is a sumptuously decorated parlor, wood-paneled, filled with plush couches and adorned with marble Greek statues. In the center of the room is the chess table, now shrouded by a cloth. Frank approaches the bar, Charlie eagerly pulls away the cloth that envelops the table, but it's not a chess table — it's a checkers table. Charlie completes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Findley spots Bert, takes a long sip from his smoothie, and glides toward them. Bert gestures to Eddie and claps his hands, pretending to forget Findley's name; he waves to them all and drifts away. Sarah gives Bert a glance. The camera pans upward from a jazz ensemble pumping out a lively rhythm to find Sarah ascending the escalator, gazing at the gathering above. Holding the railing with one hand, and a fruit punch in the other, she navigates her way up the steps. She halts a bellhop on the way down and swaps her drink for a fresh one. We follow her unstable, marionette-like ascent as she marches slowly, dreamily past the ensemble, past Eddie, who is engaged by a trendy redhead in a high-necked gown, and past Findley, alone with his snack, surveying his visitors; she continues past the glossy-eyed pairs on the dance floor, until she reaches the snack table. Bert is there too, his feet tapping to the jazz beat, his eyes roving over her figure so plainly hidden by a gingham dress. Twirling away from him, she takes her drink and wanders to a corner of the room. Bert strolls nonchalantly to her side, leans over, and murmurs something in her ear. Her expression stiffens, and furiously she turns and tosses her juice in his face and shatters her glass on the floor. She begins to weep and starts to slip, but Bert steadies her by the elbows. The music halts, and the dancing pairs struggle to glimpse what has occurred. Eddie elbows through the staring crowd, attempts to cradle her, but she pounds on his shoulders, sobbing, unable to speak. Eddie hauls her listless, quivering form across the dance floor to the escalator while Bert watches them depart, wiping the juice off his jacket sleeves. The music resumes. A Latina maid sits patiently in the room, keeping watch over Sarah and the shoes that Sarah is lying on. A man enters and, annoyed, nudges Sarah off his leather brogues. Eddie appears in the threshold, and the man takes his shoes and exits. Eddie gazes at Sarah for a moment, then turns and strides out. Findley, snack and candy-tipped e-cigarette in hand, accompanies Bert and Eddie up the stairs to his leisure room. It is a beautifully arranged parlor, stone-paneled, filled with plush beanbags and adorned with porcelain Greek sculptures. In the center of the room is the card table, now covered by a sheet. Findley heads to the minibar, Eddie eagerly pulls back the sheet that covers the table, but it's not a poker table -- it's a chess table. Eddie finishes uncovering the table.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Wilbur notices Clyde, takes a big bite of his sandwich, and struts toward him. Clyde gestures to Marvin and claps his hands, pretending to remember Wilbur's name; he winks to them all and departs. Lila gives Clyde a nod. The spotlight swivels upward from a jazz quartet booming out a lively rhythm to see Lila ascending the escalator, gazing at the gathering above. Grasping the pillar with one hand, and a wine goblet in the other, she weaves her way up the incline. She stops a chef on the way downstairs and swaps her goblet for a fresh one. We follow her wobbly, puppet-like ascent as she glides swiftly, dreamily past the quartet, past Marvin, who is cornered by a trendy redhead in a deep-cut blouse, and past Wilbur, solo with his soda, inspecting his visitors; she continues by the glazed-eyed pairs on the stage, until she reaches the buffet. Clyde is there as well, his head nodding to the jazz rhythm, his eyes scanning over her figure so plainly hidden by a wool plaid jumpsuit. Twirling away from him, she grabs her goblet and heads to a nook of the hall. Clyde strides lazily to her side, leans over, and murmurs something in her ear. Her expression stiffens, and furiously she turns and hurls her wine in his face and shatters her goblet on the ground. She begins to laugh and starts to stumble, but Clyde steadies her by the elbows. The rhythm ceases, and the stage pairs strain to glimpse what has transpired. Marvin shoves through the staring mob, attempts to embrace her, but she taps on his shoulder, laughing, unable to form words. Marvin pulls her limp, quivering form along the stage to the escalator while Clyde observes them leave, dabbing the wine off his jacket sleeves. The rhythm picks up again. An elderly librarian sits calmly in the hallway, overseeing Lila and the rugs that Lila is sprawled on. A child enters and, disdainful, nudges Lila off her silk shawl. Marvin appears in the entryway, and the child grabs her shawl and exits. Marvin gazes at Lila for a second, then turns and strides out. Wilbur, soda and cinnamon roll in hand, accompanies Clyde and Marvin up the escalator to his entertainment room. It is an elegantly adorned gallery, stone-tiled, filled with soft couches and adorned with marble Greek sculptures. In the middle of the gallery is the foosball table, currently veiled by a sheet. Wilbur goes to the buffet, Marvin eagerly tugs back the sheet that covers the table, but it's not a ping-pong table -- it's a foosball table. Marvin finishes revealing the table.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Findley approaches Bert, who pretends to forget his name and leaves. Sarah descends the stairs with a champagne glass, exchanges it for a fresh one, and walks through the party, passing Eddie, engaged with a chic blonde, and Findley observing guests. At the bar, Bert leans in to whisper in Sarah's ear, causing her to angrily throw champagne in his face and smash the glass. As her emotions overwhelm her, Bert catches her as she starts to fall. The music halts as the stunned crowd watches. Eddie pushes through to hold Sarah, but she resists, crying. He carries her off the dance floor as the music resumes. A maid observes Sarah resting on coats; a woman rudely moves Sarah to retrieve her coat. Eddie briefly looks at Sarah before leaving with Bert, as Findley escorts them to a lavish game room. Eddie eagerly uncovers the billiard table, only to find it's not a pool table.

upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one Holding the rail with one hand and a champagne glass in the other she maneuvers her way down the steps Her face hardens and angrily she turns and throws her champagne in his face and smashes her glass on the floor Bert walks casually to her side leans over and whispers something in her ear Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd tries to take her in his arms but she beats on his chest sobbing unable to make words Bert is there too his head bobbing to the Dixie beat his eyes running over her body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress In the center of the room is the billiard table now covered by a cloth Eddie finishes uncovering the table Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment then turns and walks out Eddie drags her limp trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go wiping the champagne off his coat lapels Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table but it is not a pool table Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name She starts to cry and starts to fall but Bert holds her up by the shoulders A Negro maid sits patiently in the room watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on he nods to them all and leaves The music starts up again it is a billiard table The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs looking on at the party below Roman statuary We follow her unsteady dolllike descent as she moves slowly dreamily past the combo past Eddie who is cornered by a chic blonde in a lowcut dress and past Findley alone with his drink observing his guests she continues past the blearyeyed couples on the dance floor until she comes to the bar It is a beautifully appointed salon woodpaneled filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta Findley spots Bert takes a long drag on his cigarette and saunters toward them Sarah gives Bert a look Eddie appears in the doorway and the woman takes her coat and leaves

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Eddie shoves through the gawking crowd tries to take her in his arms but she beats on his chest sobbing unable to make words Eddie drags her limp trembling body across the dance floor to the stairs while Bert watches them go wiping the champagne off his coat lapels The music starts up again A Negro maid sits patiently in the room watching over Sarah and the coats that Sarah is lying on A woman enters and disgusted pushes Sarah off her fur coat Eddie appears in the doorway and the woman takes her coat and leaves Eddie looks at Sarah for a moment then turns and walks out Findley drink and corktipped cigarette in hand escorts Bert and Eddie down the stairs to his game room It is a beautifully appointed salon woodpaneled filled with plush divans and decorated with terra cotta Roman statuary In the center of the room is the billiard table now covered by a cloth Findley goes to the bar Eddie eagerly pulls back the cloth that covers the table but it is not a pool table it is a billiard table Eddie finishes uncovering the table Findley spots Bert takes a long drag on his cigarette and saunters toward them Bert points to Eddie and snaps his fingers pretending to forget Findley's name he nods to them all and leaves Sarah gives Bert a look The camera tilts upward from a Dixieland combo blaring out a bouncy tune to find Sarah descending the stairs looking on at the party below Holding the rail with one hand and a champagne glass in the other she maneuvers her way down the steps She stops a waitress on the way upstairs and exchanges her glass for a new one We follow her unsteady dolllike descent as she moves slowly dreamily past the combo past Eddie who is cornered by a chic blonde in a lowcut dress and past Findley alone with his drink observing his guests she continues past the blearyeyed couples on the dance floor until she comes to the bar Bert is there too his head bobbing to the Dixie beat his eyes running over her body so plainly covered by a cotton print dress Spinning away from him she takes her glass and goes to a corner of the room Bert walks casually to her side leans over and whispers something in her ear Her face hardens and angrily she turns and throws her champagne in his face and smashes her glass on the floor She starts to cry and starts to fall but Bert holds her up by the shoulders The music stops and the dance couples strain to get a look at what has happened
